data.title: Casual
data.text: I had been ordering food for a long time , arroz chaufa de pollo or lomo salteado beef one of my favorites their hot sauce to die for and their patron  coronaritas are so good , but I have to admire that last month I ordered two arroz chaufa and the chicken and rice were old very disappointed but I did called to the restaurant to let them know that I was not happy with my meals I warning them to make sure it doesn't happen again or to someone else because it wasn't lamos $40.00 dinner , but I definetely will go back

data.title: Great flavors
data.text: This restaurant has a great selection of sea food. It doesn't matter if you are looking for a traditional plate. This restaurant knows how to deliver a delicious dish to you. If you want something new, different of the traditional chain restaurant try Empire of The Inca. It is family oriented and it will give enough options of choose a dish that you will like

data.title: Great Peruvian food
data.text: Awesome food and great service!  Asked for specific items...and the waitress was very agreeable.  We've also done takeout and it's fantastic.

data.title: Nice if you like peruvian food
data.text: This place has a nice atmosphere, and good service.  The food was okay but my companion was not crazy about south American food, so I guess we are not going back there very  often. Otherwise, it was a good experience.

data.title: Awesome !
data.text: Wonderful dinner. Ceviche was so fresh and a great portion size for the price. Pisco sours are also good. Can't wait to go back.
